comment: Great and funny guy, tries to make lectures interesting but they can be long and boring. 3 or 4 tests during the semester all of which can be difficult. If you put in the studying and take good notes you will definitely pass.

Not everybody will like Professor Forsberg. I for one absolutely loved the class. His teaching style does include a lot of PowerPoints, but even more visual demonstrations. If you don't understand a concept, he is more than willing to assist you outside of class. The tests are straightforward, just study the material, and this class is an easy A.

Forsberg is by far the most unorganized professor I have ever had. We would go over problems and he wouldn't even be able to do it without looking at a key. He also would go back and forth having to think about if his answer was correct or not. He took WEEKS to grade things. And took him days to answer emails. He caused SO MUCH unnecessary stress.

He's a teacher not a singer in KSU, so his music skills don't apply. He's all over the place during lectures, but I also had hard time focusing due to personal issue. He's late on grades. HW is graded for completion. Exams are tough, but online reviews help. He tries to help you understand if you want to learn. He's TOO NICE, & over works himself.

He is a solid prof because he is very knowledgeable about what he is teaching, but he often goes on tangents or spends an excessive amount of time on one problem. He's super nice and will help you outside of class if you need it. His midterm and final are half take home which helps, and the rest of your grade is homework.

Dan the man... He's a great guy. His attendance policy is amazing, show up if you want. His grade scale consists of HW grades, Midterm (Take home portion(50%) and in-person), and the same for the final. The work isn't easy, but he's a very lenient professor and allows for extra credit at the end. The Final is harder than Midterm! Would take again!

Micro can be difficult at times. Weekly online quizzes and packback discussion posts (easy points!). Exams can be tricky, but fair. He uses Scantrons and no notes are permitted! Watch the lectures/go to class. Utilize office hours if needed. Exams are very concept based so it may be the opposite of the practice test. He wants you to learn!
Hes so unorganized and his lectures are confusing. you basically have to teach yourself BUT the discussions are easy & the quizzes are online , theyre quite easy too

Professor Forsberg is one of the coolest people you will ever meet. He plays guitar and piano really well, and has a beautiful voice. If you talk to him during his office hours, he will always help you to make sure you have what you need to succeed. If you actually put in the work and the hours, you will do well in this class.

I have no strong feelings one way or another about Daniel Forsberg. He is a professor and he has been to Colombia. His hair is blond. His height is average for a male. If you need to take ECON 2300 (Business Statistics), then he is a professor you might have.

Professor is a great guy, kinda funny and pretty care free. In my course we had 3 tests and a final which is the majority of your grade. The tests are pretty difficult but he does offer extra credit after each exam. You also have weekly quizzes and discussion posts of sorts, which are fairly easy. will have to work for your grade but should pass.

This professor is someone who likes to make things difficult for no reason. Terrible lecturer. Time is better spent watching videos online. Ridiculous exams. For exam 2, class average was a 58 and he still didn't even curve it. Also he made sure he posted the failing grades 1 minute after the drop/add deadline. Doesn't respond to email either.

"Sometimes I make this class harder than it needs to be just so I know you have a good understanding of the material" should've been my sign to drop the class. The class average for the first test was the lowest he had seen in 4+ years in teaching. The second test had the class average at a 58 (which he posted MINUTES after the Withdraw deadline).

A freshman class that is unnecessarily hard. Really bad at explaining formulas and how he gets his answers for people who are really bad/rusty with math from high school. Wouldnt recommend for anyone who isnt good with math in general.

This class is HARD. I honestly have no idea how I got an A in this class. Took this class in the summer and the professor had amazing communication until week 3 and then ghosted until days before the final b/c he got overwhelmed with all his classes. But if I had any questions, he would fully answer them, even if he had to make an additional video.

Great teacher and really cool dude. He does do a lot of lecturing but makes it as interesting as he can. 3 big exams and 2-3 simple quizzes a day which are really easy if you pay attention. Makes great music and really cute too which makes the class way more interesting.

Class was asynchronous so pretty much was do it yourself and get it done before Sunday. We used PackBack so you had to post a discussion and reply to 2 other students. Quizzes were based on the indicated chapters but you don't need the textbook to pass. Just follow the lectures and study guides.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Lecture heavy

comment: Professor Forsberg is an amazing professor who does his best to keep the lectures interesting. I highly recommend taking him for ECON 2106
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Skip class? You won't pass.--Amazing lectures

comment: The best professor I have had at KSU!! Really cares about his students and does the best he can to help you do your best. Super kind and makes his lectures very interesting!

Professor Forsberg is my favorite so far.  In a hard class like economics it is imperative that you get a good professor. If you have a chance to take this guy take him.  Very straightforward if you study you will succeed.  Gives plenty of extra credit if you need it. He is an all-around great person and guy. You would have to try to fail. He

Overall Daniel is a solid choice. He does try to make his mandatory classes entertaining and has cool stories and cheesy jokes. Quiz each week but they are short and not too hard. No lockdown browsers. Even made the final optional if you are happy with your grade. He is a good and thorough teacher and he has by far done the best at teaching me econ
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class--Lecture heavy

comment: Econ is sometimes boring but he makes the lectures fun to follow, lots of jokes and references lol. Exams are open note, if you are happy with your grade you don't have to take the final exam. Overall super cool dude. p.s. ask him about his band
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Clear grading criteria--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: Very nice guy but tests were very challenging. You can tell he has passion for teaching which is refreshing but this class is not an easy A. If you put in the work you can get a good grade.

Coming into an economics class required for me to take I was expecting the class to be boring, Professor Forsberg made lectures and topics interesting. There are three tests, weekly quizzes, lectures for each chapter, and study guides provided. As long as you know what you should know, the class is an easy A. I actually learned a lot in this class.
rating_tags: Accessible outside class--Graded by few things--Amazing lectures

comment: This class is straightforward and there was a quiz every week over each chapter.

Hes a good professor in the sense that hell try and crack jokes, often at his expense, to keep the class engaged. He sometimes goes off topic while teaching, getting into subjects that arent graded in the class. My advice for this class is make sure you read the textbook chapters. It is easy to get lost on the topic during lectures.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.--Test heavy

comment: Fun proffesor, hes young and you can tell he has a Passion for econ. His test arnt the easiest but arnt the hardest either. Final is way easier than the other test i took in there... attendance is takin via online polls.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: 2 quizzes per week with 2 attempts allowed, 3 exams & 1 final. Practice exams not like exams. You have to work hard to get the grade you want. Participation is a grade. Prepare to work hard in this class.

Honestly, he wasn't that bad of a teacher. I'm taking him again for Econ 1000. I made a B+ in his class, and I didn't even try in the class. All of the questions are from the power points. He's a really cool person in general and he really cares about how well you do in the class. Love him!! Definitely take him if you can.

Mr. Daniel Forsberg was a fantastic professor: *3 tests that dictate the majority of your grade (Easy and right off the lecture slides) *Attendance and in-class questions for extra credit (up to 6 bonus points on final class grade) *Weekly quizzes that act as homework (sometimes by book) *Funny and helpful professor I would recommend!

The guy knows his stuff. If you aren't good with econ then go to his lectures because he explains everything very well, but all you need for the tests are in his powerpoints which he posts. 1 quiz (online) per chapter and 3 tests which aren't that difficult and his study guides help a lot. No final. 10/10 recommend
rating_tags: Graded by few things--Test heavy--Lecture heavy

comment: I liked Dan but it was because I went to his office hours. He will help you with any concept and he even said that his class is more difficult than the other econ classes but his final is easy and he gives extra credit. He is a bit bland at first but he is not as bad as people say.
This class was just so hard I dont even understand how. The tests? Forget about it. Theres just no way.

This is not a bad professor by any means. Econ is naturally not an easy class for everyone. I'm not good with Econ at all, but I can't say that is the same with everyone. This class will be either very easy or very hard for you. If you find Econ is not something you are good at, then get a tutor to get help for this class. Otherwise, withdraw!
Do not take this class......... This class was so hard for absolutely no reason. Tests were ridiculous and I just do not recommend this proff or class.
Super hard class and would not recommend taking... I actually went to every class and tried my hardest... Nice guy, tough tough class.

I've been writing funny posts (but truthful) on the other professors I had, but Daniel is a great guy all around. He is a young guy who just wants to teach students and let them have a good grade if they deserve it. There's a little bit of work, but its all super easy. Hes played bass in a band so ask him about it. Great guy I would take him again.
Nice guy but lots of homework that was really hard, lectures when I did go were really dry, he was alright but the homework was to much

Dr. Forsberg is an interesting guy. His lectures are somewhat boring but you learn from them. Homework is done through mindtap so you have to purchase the textbook. 3 exams, a cumulative final, and short online practice quizzes. There are several opportunities to make up work and to earn extra credit. He is in a band is actually a good singer.

He cares and tries to maximize points with how he grades. Tough exams, but If you go to class, asks questions, and study your notes you'll be fine. Final is super easy it's the same as practice tests. He offered extra points and tells you in the beginning of the semester. Mindtap assignments and quiz on D2L due each week they aren't hard.

Lectures are pretty solid for such a dry topic. A good bit of homework and a quiz which was always due on Sundays. Sweet and funny. Tests can be difficult especially if you didn't grasp a concept. Can tell he cares about the subject he teaches, just depends if you like the topic. Cool guy though, likes to bike to work and is in a band

He is a really nice guy, but not that great of a teacher. Lots of work outside the class and the reviews for the exams dont really help all that much. The online quizzes are the only easy thing about this class.

This class had a lot of information but he did an over all good job at presenting it. Lots of online homework but it counts for a decent amount of your final grade. Three exams and the final plus lots of easy D2L quizzes and plenty of opportunities for extra credit. He's funny and caring and makes himself available outside of class for help.

Probably the hardest class I've taken so far. Definitely a lot of information to take in and the tests can and will make your head spin. Forsberg definitely asks a lot from his students, but I wouldn't hesitate to take another class with him. Very funny, cool dude who really knows his stuff. Oh, and don't forget to ask him about his band, too.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Skip class? You won't pass.--Hilarious

comment: This class was very hard. But the prof. made up for it. He is very funny and kept the class entertained. Learned a lot. The main thing I took away from it was that you cannot go below the line of perfect elasticity.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Hilarious--Amazing lectures

comment: Attendance is mandatory due to the app for participation and little quizzes. There are extra credits, which is lectures. Overall, the professor is awesome, but I heard he's not teaching from fall semester. He always gives best answer when I have the questions.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: Hes a really nice person. Super funny and his lectures were actually interesting for a subject like Econ. I felt like I was pretty bad at the subject but he was able to explain it in a way where I could finally understand it. Also, ask him about his band. (& hell definitely bring up his RMP rating in class, he loves his chili pepper)

Professor Forsberg brought knowledge, humor, and relatability to a class that could otherwise have been dull. The class is easy enough if you just show up and take good notes, and you have many opportunities to improve your grade. Attendance does count towards your grade, there are weekly(ish) online open-book quizzes, and there is extra credit.
Really chill guy. Gives extra credit for good attendance. Some quizzes and discussions now and then, 4 tests. Curves tests heavily if class does terrible. I was terrible at Econ and I made a B.
I thought this class would be an easy A however I was wrong. Hes a nice professor and trys to make sure his students understand but his lectures are super boring.

Daniel is a cool dude! While Economics is not my cup of tea, his lectures were entertaining. There are several quizzes, 3 tests, and a final, but there is a participation grade for answering things via PollEverywhere, which is how he gets attendance. I didn't always do well on the tests, but the participation and extra credit will help your grade.

He does Poll Everywhere as attendance, so you can login and do it even if you cannot make it to class. But he does lock it after about a minute and does it at random times during the class period. Tests are difficult but gives practice exams as study guides, very similar. Overall nice guy who you can talk to if you need help.

Professor Forsberg makes Economics bearable. He is very lecture heavy, but makes them fun and interesting. Attendance is not mandatory, but he does check it. There are weekly quizzes, but he encourages you to work with other people on them. Three exams plus the final, and they are all pretty easy.

All around cool guy and challenging but fair class. One of the first classes to me that actually FELT like a college-level class. Frequent reading and study sessions are a must, as well as class participation in order to grasp key concepts. He's a very understanding guy, so don't be afraid to ask him any questions about grades and tests and such.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Skip class? You won't pass.--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: He is super relaxed and accessible, which makes him so great. The class is pretty lecture heavy, but he allows his personality to make it less boring. He uses an app with questions to check attendance and you get graded on attendance from that, but it also provides opportunities for extra credit. I would definitely take him again! Tests arent bad

Mr. Forsberg is a great guy. Econ is a hard class with whomever you take it with. He will work with you to help you understand. I have enjoyed his course. Do the work and show respect and he will do the same for you.
Great guy

Yeah hes super extra for someone teaching Econ1000. I guess cause all hes taught was Econ2200, but hes super extra. He does little quiz questions during class through an app and thats how he does attendance.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Skip class? You won't pass.--BEWARE OF POP QUIZZES

comment: I think Daniel is one of the best professors I have ever had. He is very caring and funny. He is a pretty chill guy and is in an actual band! He made econ very interesting for me and I am now an econ tutor. I don't agree with the person that says he would belittle you for differing opinions, he might show you why the facts you based it on are wrong

Favorite professor I've had so far. I'm an Econ major so this class was easy for me but he really does care about his students understanding the material and their grades. I wish he was teaching upper level Econ classes because I would take him again in a heartbeat! Also he's lead singer in a alternative blues inspired rock band and it's v good.
rating_tags: LOTS OF HOMEWORK--EXTRA CREDIT--Would take again

comment: Nice guy. Young, funny, very smart; plays in a legit band. Loves Econ. Thinks really fast. Cares about his students and about meeting his teaching reqs. Weekly hmwrk. 3 tests & cumulative final (easiest of all the tests). You have to study but it's not a hard class nor a hard teacher. You'll come out more knowledgeable on the other end.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Clear grading criteria--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: Great Professor! He gives study guides for the tests and you have access to the PowerPoints that he lectures over. The homework can be a pain but it does force you to keep up with the material. There was also a couple of extra credit opportunities. I would definitely take again!
rating_tags: LOTS OF HOMEWORK--EXTRA CREDIT--Would take again

comment: Econ is a tough subject for me, but he is a very understanding and flexible professor. His tests are difficult but he does give you many opportunities to successfully pass his class. I would take him again in the future.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--LOTS OF HOMEWORK--Tests are tough

comment: Excellent professor! Econ is a tough subject for me but I enjoyed taking his class. He is very knowledgeable and is always available after class or during office hours to help students. He wants his students to succeed and gives plenty of opportunities to do so! Highly recommend

He seems nice. Sometimes you can visibly see that you are annoying him with questions. His first test is difficult, second test is easier, and the third test is brutal. I think sometimes he doesn't know how to dumb things down enough for an entry level econ class. He's not a bad professor.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS--GRADED BY FEW THINGS

comment: He does truly care about his students. He tries to make the class as real world as possible. He is very kind and responds fast to emails. Sometimes he doesn't explain things as well in class, but he is always available via email or during office hours. He gives study guides similar to the test. Highly recommend taking him.
